I like doubting a lot and I consider truth something I think quite plausible rather than proven by an external authority to be true.

Consider things like, how often is that character used, and what's the easiest way to quickly telling it apart from others. If the character is rare then that's ok, if it's common then it's likely characters of similar density and strokes aren't, and even if they are, one could focus on the differences so you'd challenge a portion of that character against what you think it could be and focus your sight on said section instead of checking the whole thing. Also, sometimes characters like this are common only because they are used in a certain amount of fixed sentences, like phrases and says, so you could emphasize getting the context where it appears instead of the precise character and call it a day.

I just noticed that zeronet sidebar doesn't work in Kave, are you aware of it or am I doing something wrong?

Pulling the sidebar triggers this in my rev4372:
**Unhandled exception: UnboundLocalError: local variable 'is_prev_builtin' referenced before assignment in corecext.pyx line 548 > DebugHook.py line 87 > 53 > Debug.py line 82 > 42**

Fixed it, it had to do with python-geven-git I was using. But I noticed something else and this is your issue instead. The way you are making the site is not wise, I deleted Kave and redownloaded it, the front page is ok but upon entering any of the categories it will download the thumbnails of the videos (good) and also part of the videos as well (bad). I'm seeing among 3-4M for most vids and tears of steel one downloads 7M, probably is a fixed amount of time for each video but if your catalog grows it will download the start of all those videos. Unacceptable!!

I think it may come from the usage of all those video players (I don't like them that way, but it is your zite after all). Keep them all if you want but solve that weird prefetching issue, we users suffer from it.

PS: I'll be back in 10+ hours.

I prefer to read pdfs in-browser with pdf.js, but that won't work since zeronet imposes some http content headers taht make everything download unless it's some kind of well-known media format (mp3, mkv, ogg, etc....).

```
# Download instead of display file types that can be dangerous
if re.findall("/svg|/xml|/x-shockwave-flash|/pdf", content_type):
    headers["Content-Disposition"] = "attachment"
```

zeronet/src/Ui/UiRequest.py#299L

Is your laptop using an AMD apu by any chance? AMD made a good job by fitting their igpus in those processors, though, being from 2010 I'm not so sure about their hardware decoding capabilities.

I'm not that sure about it being as lean, many apps nowadays keep lingering in the background with loaded libs, waiting for the user to call them. Many even install services in the system for that very purpose (windows services). You should check on its memory consumption.

I don't think they'd incur in those practices on linux but I've pretty much never used browsers other than firefox based ones on linux (you know, windows everywhere). I don't even know if chrome does that in linux, it surely does in windows.
It's really pretty, but some of those plants are considered weeds from their resilience and speed of propagation, and others are toxic to cattle, pets and humans (given the right dosage).

@Styromaniac: I mean, it's nothing to worry just now. I just know a bit of the Kalanchoe and [Daigremontianum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryophyllum_daigremontianum) ones, commonly know as mother of millions and mother of thousands. They are succulents that reproduce generally by producing clones of themselves at the tips of their leaves, they spread quickly by dropping hundreds of themselves nearby and those grow over time to do the same. Both normally carry some chemical agents in then that produce cardiac arrest (after a certain dosage) on cattle and pets. There have been cases of whole farm worth of cattle being lost from said animals foraging over wild kalanchoe/daigremontianum.
Just, make sure you put them in wide pots so there's no much worry when they grow and don't leave them in a place where pets could go gnaw them. That's it!

Man, I don't want you avoiding those nice plants over an exaggerated reaction. I even have daigremontianum at home, they won't just take over your garden overnight and they are really easy to take care of. Just a wide pot and that's it, if you are worried about animals then try hanging it from the somewhere.

Which at the same time would also go against the first statement since there would be something that is not possible, when everything should.
